Issues.Title: Add a mechanism to reload a component
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? core ### Description App.component.html: `
` Add a mechanism to reload child component in app component so that the child component can be recreated and go through the initial lifecycle. ### Proposed solution 1. By adding ViewChild to refer to the child component and call ParentComponent.reloadView(childComponent). 2. By adding a key to the child component. If the key is changed, then the component will be auto-reload like the one in React.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add a mechanism to reload a component" (#51302)

Issues.Title: New tag
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

animations, bazel, common, compiler-cli, compiler, core, elements, forms, language-service, localize, platform-browser-dynamic, platform-browser, platform-server, router, service-worker, upgrade

### Description

I am currently using the tag `latest` to be always up-to-date. But when a major version comes out I am being updated to this new major version, which can be problematic.

### Proposed solution

My suggestion is to already add the tag v16-lts to the latest v16 version, as it is done for older version. So when 17 comes out, I will not be updated automatically to the new major version.

### Alternatives considered

Use "^16.0.0", but in this case I always have to run `npm install` and `npm update` to ensure that I am on the latest version.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "New tag" (#51305)

Issues.Title: feat(router): Add feature to support the View Transitions API
Issues.Body:
The View Transitions API enables easy animations when transitioning between different DOM states. This commit adds an opt-in feature to the Router which runs the component activation and deactivation logic in the `document.startViewTransition` callback. If the browser does not support this API, route activation and deactivation will happen synchronously.

resolves #49401
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(router): Add feature to support the View Transitions API" (#51314)

Issues.Title: Add possibility to have global directives
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

Now that standalone components feature is released, it is a good idea to get rid of modular architecture.

But that idea is coming with a requirement: we need to import everything what is needed right to standalone components. At first glance it sounds attractive, we import only something what is needed in that component. But what about global directives?

For example, let's imagine directive like `@Directive({ selector: 'form' })` which does something to each form element.

In modular architecture this directive is imported to some shared module which will be imported into feature modules.
In module-less architecture we would need to import it into each standalone component.

The main concern here is that it can be easily missed. There won't be any compilation or runtime error and IDE will not highlight it.

### Proposed solution

Extend `Directive` decorator with `providedIn` property like in `Injectable`. E.g.
```typescript
@Directive({
  selector: 'form',
  providedIn: 'root',
})
```

### Alternatives considered

The alternative way is to create a module with global directives and import it to each standalone component even if it is not used there.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add possibility to have global directives" (#51297)

Issues.Title: feat: expose a method to provide functional http interceptors without having to use withInterceptors([...])
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

common

### Description

When using class based interceptors we were able to just provide a token and it would be registered. 

```ts
providers: [
  {
    provide: HTTP_INTERCEPTORS,
    useClass: ErrorsInterceptor,
    multi: true,
  }
]
```

This gave us the possibility to just provide this token and the DI would do it's job to register the interceptor. 

With functional http interceptors, we loose this ability because we have to register them using the [withInterceptor()](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/1eda1bdfccc09426ea8d8dd8cfbd8f521cc15f14/packages/common/http/src/provider.ts#L111) method inside [provideHttpClient()](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/1eda1bdfccc09426ea8d8dd8cfbd8f521cc15f14/packages/common/http/src/provider.ts#L68C17-L68C34) like this: 

```ts
providers: [
  provideHttpClient(withInterceptors([errorInterceptor]))
]
```

This is great until we need to add providers or interceptors from a library. For example: 

```ts
providers: [
  provideHttpCache()
]
```

I want to be able register some http interceptors from this provider function directly (just like we were able to do it before).

### Proposed solution

Maybe expose [HTTP_INTERECPTOR_FNS](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/1eda1bdfccc09426ea8d8dd8cfbd8f521cc15f14/packages/common/http/src/interceptor.ts#L155) so we can just provide this token with our providers just like before. 

Or expose a method that provides this token with our value. 

Sth like: 

```ts
provideInterceptors([errorInterceptor])
```

### Alternatives considered

Use class based interceptors.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat: expose a method to provide functional http interceptors without having to use withInterceptors([...])" (#51303)

Issues.Title: Router title get assigned before navigationEnd.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Whenever we start navigation, if we've assigned a title in routes then it will get patched before navigation ends. So the issue is that if the user cancels navigation or we do it programmatically, then the title was already patched. So it looks kind of buggy.

Issues.Title: Enable using the runtime dependency tracker in JIT compiler
Issues.Body:
This change simply flips the flag `USE_RUNTIME_DEPS_TRACKER_FOR_JIT` guarding usage of runtime dependency tracker in the JIT compiler. As a result, the JIT compiler will use the runtime dependency tracker for calculating scopes instead of patching them into the types. 

This change particularly affects all the Angular tests in g3. Multiple TGPs were run, including [this most recent one](https://fusion2.corp.google.com/presubmit/554610152/OCL:554610152:BASE:554552090:1691471462261:98ccfc2f;groups=NewlyFailing,PossiblyAlreadyFailing/targets) and all were green. 

In the event of any further failure, we can simply revert this PR (or alternatively just set the flag `USE_RUNTIME_DEPS_TRACKER_FOR_JIT` to false) to resolve the issue.

Once this change was confirm not to break anything, the flag `USE_RUNTIME_DEPS_TRACKER_FOR_JIT` will be deleted in a separate PR.

Also, some internal tests had to be updated as we adopt to use the runtime dependency tracker.

Issues.Title: fix(router): Apply named outlets to children of empty paths not appearing in the URL
Issues.Body:
Empty path routes are effectively 'passthrough' routes that do not appear in the URL. When these exist in the route tree, we do not want to apply named outlet commands to that tree location. Instead, we skip past this location in the tree, effectively squashing/removing this passthrough route from the tree.

fixes #50356

Issues.Title: Massive overhead with flushAnimations even with NoopAnimationsModule on Universal
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? animations ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When using the NoopAnimationsModule on Universal, my flame chart looks like this: Note the massive overhead on the flushAnimations. I wrote a monkey patch just to test: ``` let patched = true; if (!patched) { const originalFlush = ɵAnimationEngine.prototype.flush; ɵAnimationEngine.prototype.flush = function(...args: any[]): any {}; patched = true; } ``` The page still renders on Universal - to be honest I didn't see any differences with JS disabled - but this time the burndown chart looks like this: The render completes in about half the time, and most of that time is idle time (waiting for API / async operations to complete). I would say it's possibly around a 10x difference in our case. Is this normal behaviour, or perhaps something that might be wrong with the project? ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug _No response_ ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true No error ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 15.2.9 Node: 18.16.1 Package Manager: yarn 1.22.19 OS: darwin arm64 Angular: 15.2.9 ... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core ... forms, localize, material, platform-browser ... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router ... youtube-player Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1502.9 @angular-devkit/build-angular 15.2.9 @angular-devkit/core 15.2.9 @angular-devkit/schematics 13.3.11 @angular/flex-layout 14.0.0-beta.41 @angular/google-maps 13.2.6 @nguniversal/builders 15.2.0 @nguniversal/express-engine 14.2.3 @schematics/angular 15.2.9 rxjs 7.8.0 typescript 4.8.4 webpack 5.74.0 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: feat(core): add `setFakeBaseSystemTime()` to public API
Issues.Body:
Allows to specify a fake time in fakeAsync tests. Similar to using Jasmines "Clock" with a mockDate, which cannot be used in fakeAsync tests.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->
If you want to specify a fake "now" time in your tests, you need to use [Jasmines "Clock" feature](https://jasmine.github.io/api/5.1/Clock) with a mockDate. This does not work in fakeAsync tests. You need to remove fakeAsync from your test and use `jasmine.clock().tick()` instead of the usual `tick()`.

In our project we use page objects to interact with our components. They rely on being used in fakeAsync tests, because their methods call the `tick()` function. That means, currently we cannot use them in combination with a fake time.

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?

In a fakeAsync test, you can specify a fake "now" time by calling `setFakeBaseSystemTime()`.


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(core): add `setFakeBaseSystemTime()` to public API" (#51286)

Issues.Title: @use SCSS imports seem to not allow directories in path inside Angular Library
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

12.1.3

### Description

In a past Angular project (Angular 12) I could `@use` a SCSS file from a root folder in Angular libraries using the format:

```
@use 'sass-utils/cssvars' as *
```

In a new project I created using Angular 16, this is no longer resolved. I found a previous bug referenced [here](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/24691) that explained that the solution was to add a `styleIncludePaths: ["../../"]` property to the `ng-package.json` file, but that did not solve the issue.

The only way to get this to resolve is adding `sass-utils` to the path in the `styleIncludePaths` property and removing `sass-utils` from the import like so:

```
@use `cssvars` as *
```

### Minimal Reproduction

- ng new my-app
- cd my-app
- ng g library common
- mkdir sass-utils #this is created in root directory
- cd sass-utils
- mkdir cssvars

Create a SCSS file in the cssvars folder named `_index.scss` and attempt to `@use` it in the common library.

In addition, add the following `styleIncludePath` property in the `ng-package.json` file for the `common` library

```
"lib": {
  "entryFile": "src/public-api.ts",
  "styleIncludePaths": ["../../"]
}
```

### Exception or Error

```text
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Building entry point 'common'
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
✖ Compiling with Angular sources in Ivy partial compilation mode.
Can't find stylesheet to import.
  ╷
1 │ @use "sass-utils/cssvars" as *;
  │ ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  ╵
  test/test.component.scss 1:1  root stylesheet
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 16.1.8
Node: 16.16.0
Package Manager: npm 8.11.0
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 16.1.8
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.1.8
@angular-devkit/core            16.1.8
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.1.8

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): reduce source map resolution…
Issues.Body:
… to word boundary

magic-string 0.30.2 introduced [the `boundary` strategy][1] for its high-resolution source map mode, reducing the number of source map segments to align with word boundaries instead of having a segment per character.

Issues.Title: Support unit test selection in the `ng new` configuration
Issues.Body:
### Command

new, test

### Description

CLI should have a configuration option to specify the unit test runner.

Currently, even though the Jest support is still experimental, there is hardly any guidance on how to quickly spin up a jest-driven app. The available resources differ in that one recommends `"builder": "@angular-builders/jest:run"` and another `"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:jest"`.

The latter, even though it is suggested by IDE:

![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/681956/ca4cce96-b163-418c-bc86-5773ac6e737a)

doesn't seem to validate against the JSON schema:

![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/681956/602d3591-4809-43db-a60b-3c702953634c)

unless you accept the autocomplete item which includes double `@` sign, but then it results in:

![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/681956/10b63334-e6a7-455b-93ec-3d8d60e41d6d)

There is of course some additional package installation and uninstallation going on, as well as ts.config massaging.
And the only way for me to have console free of warnings:

`warning: unable to locate custom jest configuration file at path "/........./jest.config.js"`

was to create an empty jest.config.js file (probably has to do with [this issue](https://github.com/just-jeb/angular-builders/issues/84)).

All in all, as you see, DX is not great, hits developer with a lot of confusion, takes a lot of manual work. Therefore having a "factory recommended" solution in place would be a great time-saver.


### Describe the solution you'd like

- add a `ng new` flag `--unit-test=karma|jest`
- add a `ng new` prompt (radio buttons) - with `(experimental)` hint for the user until the feature becomes stable
- add a schematic to convert karma to jest for the existing karma-driven projects 
- add docs obviously
- bonus: add a Stackblitz template for an angular app with jest

### Describe alternatives you've considered

need to do everything manually
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support unit test selection in the `ng new` configuration" (#25642)

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>prettier/eslint-config-prettier (eslint-config-prettier)</summary>

### [`v9.0.0`](https://togithub.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#Version-900-2023-08-05)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/compare/v8.10.0...v9.0.0)

-   Added: The CLI helper tool now works with eslint.config.js (flat config). Just like ESLint itself, the CLI tool automatically first tries eslint.config.js and then eslintrc, and you can force which one to use by setting the \[ESLINT_USE_FLAT_CONFIG] environment variable. Note that the *config* of eslint-config-prettier has always been compatible with eslint.config.js (flat config) – it was just the CLI tool that needed updating. On top of that, the docs have been updated to mention how to use both eslint.config.js (flat config) and eslintrc, and the tests now test both config systems.
-   Changed: \[unicode-bom] is no longer turned off. Prettier preserves the BOM if you have one, and does not add one if missing. It was wrong of eslint-config-prettier to disable that rule. If you get ESLint errors after upgrading, either add `"unicode-bom": "off"` to your config to disable it again, or run ESLint with `--fix` to fix all files according to the rule (add or remove BOM). Thanks to Nicolas Stepien ([@​nstepien](https://togithub.com/nstepien))!

</details>

Issues.Title: styleIncludePath not resolving SCSS files in Angular Library
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

12.1.3

### Description

In a past Angular project (Angular 12) I could `@use` a SCSS file from a root folder in Angular libraries using the format:

```
@use 'sass-utils/cssvars' as *
```

In a new project I created using Angular 16, this is no longer resolved. I found a previous bug referenced [here](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/24691) that explained that the solution was to add a `styleIncludePath` property to the `ng-package.json` file, but that did not solve the issue.

### Minimal Reproduction

- ng new my-app
- cd my-app
- ng g library common
- mkdir sass-utils #this is created in root directory
- cd sass-utils
- mkdir cssvars

Create a SCSS file in the cssvars folder named `_index.scss` and attempt to `@use` it in the common library.

In addition, add the following `styleIncludePath` property in the `ng-package.json` file for the `common` library

```
"lib": {
  "entryFile": "src/public-api.ts",
  "styleIncludePaths": ["../../sass-utils"]
}
```

### Exception or Error

```text
$ ng build common
Building Angular Package

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Building entry point 'common'
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
✖ Compiling with Angular sources in Ivy partial compilation mode.
Can't find stylesheet to import.
  ╷
1 │ @use "sass-utils/cssvars" as *;
  │ ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  ╵
  test/test.component.scss 1:1  root stylesheet
```
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 16.1.8
Node: 16.16.0
Package Manager: npm 8.11.0
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 16.1.8
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1601.8
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.1.8
@angular-devkit/core            16.1.8
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.1.8
@schematics/angular             16.1.8
ng-packagr                      16.1.0
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.1.6
zone.js                         0.13.1
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: bug: running "external" schematics in yarn pnp workspace
Issues.Body:
I'm finally getting around to moving a library project that uses `@schematics/angular` to use PnP, and discovered an issue with some code in the `NodeModulesEngineHost` within `@angular-devkit/schematics`.  From my code, within a unit test, we're using the `SchematicTestRunner`'s `runExternalSchematic` function to generate a test project.  Running that function from within a pnp environment is throwing the following error:

```bash
 ENOTDIR: not a directory, lstat '/node_modules/@schematics/angular/collection.json/package.json'

      21005 |
      21006 | function makeError$1(code, message) {
    > 21007 |   return Object.assign(new Error(`${code}: ${message}`), { code });
            |                        ^
      21008 | }
      21009 | function EBUSY(message) {
      21010 |   return makeError$1(`EBUSY`, message);

      at makeError$1 (../../.pnp.cjs:21007:24)
      at ENOTDIR (../../.pnp.cjs:21025:10)
      at ZipFS.resolveFilename (../../.pnp.cjs:22607:15)
      at ZipFS.realpathSync (../../.pnp.cjs:22398:28)
      at ../../.pnp.cjs:23704:100
      at ../../.pnp.cjs:24200:60
      at ZipOpenFS.getZipSync (../../.pnp.cjs:24329:14)
      at ZipOpenFS.makeCallSync (../../.pnp.cjs:24200:17)
      at ZipOpenFS.realpathSync (../../.pnp.cjs:23696:17)
      at VirtualFS.realpathSync (../../.pnp.cjs:23446:26)
      at PosixFS.realpathSync (../../.pnp.cjs:23197:41)
      at NodePathFS.realpathSync (../../.pnp.cjs:23197:41)
      at maybeRealpathSync (../../.yarn/cache/resolve-patch-6d2631dc64-66cc788f13.zip/node_modules/resolve/lib/sync.js:52:16)
      at resolveSync (../../.yarn/cache/resolve-patch-6d2631dc64-66cc788f13.zip/node_modules/resolve/lib/sync.js:97:25)
      at NodeModulesTestEngineHost.resolve (../angular_devkit/schematics/tools/node-module-engine-host.ts:61:39)
      at NodeModulesTestEngineHost.resolve (../angular_devkit/schematics/tools/node-module-engine-host.ts:68:29)
      at createTestCaseSetup (schematics/test-utils.ts:117:40)

```

This code seems to be improperly joining the `collection.json` path and the `package.json` path (/node_modules/@schematics/angular/collection.json/package.json): https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/c34bbb8dad26aca180c2f9f4e1a6ecc5c28dd3c0/packages/angular_devkit/schematics/tools/node-module-engine-host.ts#L61 and yarn doesn't know what to do with that.  

This is the code we're running within our test:
```ts
const workspaceTree = await runner.runExternalSchematic(
    '@schematics/angular',
    'workspace',
    {
      name: 'workspace',
      version: '7.0.0',
      newProjectRoot: 'projects',
    },
    tree
  );
```

It seems that the code is trying to blindly grab that path, knowing that this case will fail and hit the catch block, since it then tries an alternative approach just after that.  So, my guess is where it's checking the error type, to decide whether to absorb the error or re-throw, it needs to consider this error type too (`ENOTDIR`)?
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/c34bbb8dad26aca180c2f9f4e1a6ecc5c28dd3c0/packages/angular_devkit/schematics/tools/node-module-engine-host.ts#L69-L73

Seeing as this code isn't in the test-specific class, I suspect (but haven't verified) this might also fail for the `@angular-devkit/schematics` `externalSchematics` function.

Reproduction Repo: https://github.com/michaelfaith/ng-schematics-yarn-pnp-bug

_Originally posted by @michaelfaith in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/16980#issuecomment-1640917890_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug: running "external" schematics in yarn pnp workspace" (#25648)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): move TypeScript diagnostic conversion into compilation base
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder, TypeScript diagnostics are now converted into esbuild messages within the compilation base class instead of the plugin. This helps further isolate the TypeScript details within the compilation classes. Additionally, this provides diagnostic objects that can be more easily serialized earlier in the build process.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): conditionally enable deprecated Less stylesheet JavaScript support
Issues.Body:
When a Less stylesheet is detected to require the deprecated `javascriptEnabled` Less option, the option is enabled for the stylesheet and a warning is issued to inform the user of the behavior change. The Less `javascriptEnabled` option has been deprecated and disabled by default since Less v3 (https://github.com/less/less.js/releases/tag/v3.0.0). When enabled, the `javascriptEnabled` option allows JavaScript within Less stylesheets to be executed at build time.

Less option reference: https://lesscss.org/usage/#less-options

This provides similar behavior to the default Webpack-based build system. However, the Webpack-based build system currently unconditionally enables the option.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): conditionally enable deprecated Less stylesheet JavaScript support" (#25639)

Issues.Title: Add API for custom component theming with M3
Issues.Body:
A new API for this is necessary because the existing APIs (e.g. `mat.get-color-from-palette`) require the user to have some knowledge of how the theme object is structured. With the M3 theme objects, we made he decision that the theme object structure should be opaque to the user. 

I will do a followup PR to add support for using the same API to access values from M2 theme objects. This will allow users to move their custom components on to the new API before updating to use an M3 theme.

With the new theming APIs, I'm focusing on trying to catch common errors a user might make and report helpful error messages rather than the `$map: null is not a map` errors that our previous APIs often threw. I've added tests to cover these error cases as well as the expected cases.

I'm introducing the APIs as private in this PR, but will do a followup once they have M2 theme support to make them public.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add API for custom component theming with M3" (#27617)

Issues.Title: feat(MatCalendar): Cell data to be displayed on specific days.
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

### Context
- Using MatCalendar as a static calendar that is displayed in a page. The user can select a date/week/month and a more extensive calendar view is opened/updated on the page to for the specific day / week / month. We're using FullCalendar for the extensive calendar view.
- It would be awesome if the MatCalendar could display indicators, for example that a specific date (August 9) has 3 events on this day. Or that the specific date (August 10) has 10 events on this day.

### Visual example of what could be achieved
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/18558584/65a84681-d663-49cb-8264-81ded789c082)
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/18558584/63ef573d-3a82-4a40-a82a-0bf7146bcf93)

### Reasoning
- Using the dateClass input, I can somewhat achieve a similar thing. I can have an array / map of events, then when rendering the calendar I can match each cell to a list of events, then change the css class accordingly.
  - But the css class is not enough to show dynamic content, such as a text, a specific matTooltip, a specific callback when the cell is hovered, etc.
  - I've seem some hacks floating around that involve replacing the aria-label attribute and then adding a css class that styles the aria-label, but it seems very dirty and non flexible.
- Also, this technique does not "refresh" when changing date or if new data is available and should be shown, we have to either:
  - Call `matCalendar.updateTodaysDate()` to force a refresh, even though the date may not really have been changed...
  - Call `matCalendar['_getCurrentViewComponent']()['_init']()` to force a refresh, digging in the code to find private methods that seems to do what we intend to do (refresh each cells based on current dataSet).

### Feature request

#### If achievable currently, more documentation
- If what I'm trying to explain is available using renderer and dateClass, I would love to see an example or an explaination of how to do so.

#### If not achieveable currently
##### Provide data
- The calendar could allow the user to provide, in a way, an array of data or an observable of data associated to specific dates.
- Similar to the dateClass method, a method could be provided to configure how the cell should be rendered depending on the matching provided data.
- Custom components or a very generic component could be configured to map how a specific dataset should behave and be displayed in the context of a cell that has matching data.
  - In my use case, for example, a colored dot that opens an Overlay Panel with details about the hovered day.

##### Customize each cell view
- The calendar could "simply" call a specific method on each cell render, just like the dateClass does.
- The callback could allow us to configure the cell, its hover behavior, tooltip, dom elements that should be displayed under the day number, etc.



### Use Case

Simple use case, only visual
1. I display the Angular MatCalendar
2. User navigates to December and sees each day of December
3. The 25th is a special day, it has a red dot under the "25" to indicate it is a busy day

Simple use case, different visual
1. I display the Angular MatCalendar
2. User navigates to December and sees each day of December
3. The 25th is a special day, it has a santa hat icon under the "25" to indicate it's christmas.

Simple use case, different visual
1. I display the Angular MatCalendar
2. User navigates to December and sees each day of December
3. The 25th is a special day, it has the label "Christmas" (depending on the current Locale) under the "25".

Complex use case
1. I display the Angular MatCalendar
2. User navigates to December and sees each day of December
3. The 25th is a special day, it has a red dot to indicate it is a busy day. When I hover the red dot, a matToolTip is shown, in the appropriate language, to show details about that day.

Complex use case
1. I display the Angular MatCalendar
2. User navigates to December and sees each day of December
3. The 25th is a special day, it has a red dot to indicate it is a busy day. When I hover the red dot, I receive a callback with the appropriate data to allow me to open an Overlay Panel next to the cell and display that 5 events, with their details, are occurring on that day.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(MatCalendar): Cell data to be displayed on specific days." (#27611)

Issues.Title: bug(CDK drag and drop): animations inside of droped items
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

### Description

We have some sortable lists. For them the sorting is deactivatable. So we added some angular animations to the containers to make them appear/disappear smother. 
But after dropping an item the animations aren't shown or are buggy.

- in the bottom list it doesn't disappear

- top list works as expected again

### Expected Behavior

animations are running as intended and *ngif is working and not doubling its container

### Actual Behavior

animations aren't working

Issues.Title: fix(material/dialog): update aria-labelledby if title is swapped
Issues.Body:
Currently the dialog assigns the ID of the title as the `aria-labelleledby` of the container, but it doesn't update it if the title is swapped out or removed.

These changes add a queue of possible IDs that the container can use as titles as they are being created or destroyed.

Fixes #27599.

Issues.Title: fix(material/list): Move unthemable tokens to theme mixin
Issues.Body:
Though these tokens are not currently affected by the theme, in the future they will be affected by the design system used for theming (M2 or M3)

BREAKING CHANGE:
There are new styles emitted by `mat.list-theme` that are not emitted by any of: `mat.list-color`, `mat.list-typography`, `mat.list-density`. If you rely on the partial mixins only and don't call `mat.list-theme`, you can add `mat.list-base` to get the missing styles.

Issues.Title: bug(LiveAnnouncer): Repeated message is not announced
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

LiveAnnouncer does not announce a message when it is the same as the last announced message 
(using MacOS VoiceOver + Chrome).

### Reproduction

Using MacOS VoiceOver + Chrome

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-1j77ug?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Turn on VoiceOver
2. Open StackBlitz link
3. Click "Announce Hello" button
      -> VoiceOver announces "Hello"
4.  Click "Announce Hello" button again
      -> Expected: VoiceOver announces "Hello"
      -> Actual: No announcement


### Expected Behavior

VoiceOver announces the message.

### Actual Behavior

VoiceOver did not announce the message.

### Environment

- Angular: 16.1.8
- CDK/Material: 16.1.7
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(LiveAnnouncer): Repeated message is not announced" (#27602)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-progress-bar): starts from the middle when put in a button
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14

### Description

When putting a `mat-progress-bar` in `indeterminate`-mode inside a button, the progress bar starts animating at around 50% instead of at 0% (so completely from the left).

https://github.com/angular/components/assets/56340221/955a78de-27d1-4db1-b4a7-676b93b8577c

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-fhpfas?file=src%2Fmain.ts%3AL11,angular.json
Steps to reproduce:
1. Refresh the app.
2. Take note of the animation starting points of the progress bars.

### Expected Behavior

The progress bar should start animating from the left as it does in a `div`.

### Actual Behavior

The progress bar starts animating from around the middle.

### Environment

- Angular: 16.1.8
- CDK/Material: 16.1.7
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(mat-progress-bar): starts from the middle when put in a button" (#27598)

Issues.Title: feat(list): Introducing a Description List Component
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description ## Description As an avid user and developer of Angular Material, I have come across a common scenario where I need to display detailed information, such as product characteristics, in a more visually appealing and user-friendly manner. Currently, the available mat-list component has some limitations, particularly when dealing with longer descriptions and on mobile devices. To address these issues and enhance the overall user experience, I propose the development of a new "Description List" component for Angular Material. ## Feature Overview The Description List component will aim to simplify the display of descriptive information, especially when dealing with lengthy content. It will provide the following key features to cater to different screen sizes and use cases: - **Unrestricted Height on Mobile** On mobile devices, the Description List component will be designed to occupy the available vertical space without any height limitation. This will ensure that users can view all the content without any truncation or text ellipsis, offering a seamless browsing experience on smaller screens. - **Responsive Design** The Description List component will be responsive to adapt to different screen sizes and orientations. On mobile devices, it will provide an intuitive and easy-to-read layout, while on desktops or larger screens, it will take advantage of the additional space by displaying terms and descriptions side by side. - **Flexibility in Content Display** The Description List component will allow users to input varying lengths of labels and descriptions. It will dynamically adjust the layout based on the content's length, ensuring that information is presented in a visually appealing manner while maintaining readability. ### Use Case Introducing the Description List component will offer several benefits to developers and end-users: - **Enhanced User Experience** By providing an improved and responsive display for lengthy descriptive information, users can easily comprehend product characteristics and other details without any truncation or clutter. - **Consistency with Angular Material** The new component will seamlessly integrate into the existing Angular Material ecosystem, maintaining the consistent and professional look and feel users have come to expect. - **Reduced Development Efforts** Developers will save time and effort by utilizing this out-of-the-box component for displaying detailed information, rather than resorting to custom solutions or third-party libraries. - **Mobile-Friendly** With unrestricted height on mobile devices, the Description List component will cater to an increasing number of users accessing applications on their smartphones and tablets. ### Implementation Ideas The Description List component can be implemented by creating a new Angular Material module that includes the necessary CSS styles and layout logic or use the current `MatListModule`. It can leverage Angular's flexbox and grid systems to achieve the responsive layout and dynamic adjustments based on the content's length. #### Code Example (Potential Usage): ```html Product Name: Super Amazing Product Product Code: ABC123
Product Name:
Super Amazing Product
Product Code:
ABC123
Product Name:
Super Amazing Product
Product Code:
ABC123
``` ### Conclusion The introduction of the Description List component to Angular Material will significantly improve the display of descriptive information, particularly in scenarios with lengthy product characteristics or similar content. The component's responsiveness and flexibility will ensure an optimal user experience across different devices, making it a valuable addition to the Angular Material library. Thank you for considering this feature request. I believe that this enhancement will greatly benefit the Angular Material community and contribute to a more robust and user-friendly UI framework. I look forward to seeing this feature become a reality :). Thank you for all your efforts.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(list): Introducing a Description List Component" (#27591)

Issues.Title: bug(drag-and-drop): Scrolling a parent container while dragging an item breaks placeholder/dropspot position
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using drag-and-drop without scroll (but some parent is scrollable), the drag placeholder seems to get out of sync with the cursor when you scroll while dragging. 

### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/d1tv4h-4a6ghz?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcdk-drag-drop-custom-placeholder-example.html
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start dragging an item 
2. Scroll down, and notice the item's placeholder/dropspot is now out of sync with the cursor

### Expected Behavior

The placeholder/dropspot for dragging should always match where the user's cursor is

### Actual Behavior

The placeholder/dropspot for dragging becomes out of sync with the user's cursor when scrolling while dragging. When dropping at the cursor, the item doesn't drop in that place.

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15.2.9
- Browser(s): All
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): All
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(drag-and-drop): Scrolling a parent container while dragging an item breaks placeholder/dropspot position" (#27604)

Issues.Title: bug(MatDialog): mat-dialog-title does not reset the `aria-labelledby
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description Imagine you want to change the title of the dialog dynamically by having multiple headers and choosing the current one by `*ngIf`: ```
Create User
Edit User
....
``` Unfortunately, this won't work with the current `mat-dialog-title` directive implementation, cause it has an extra check: ``` if (container && !container._ariaLabelledBy) { container._ariaLabelledBy = this.id; } ``` In other words, when the first `mat-dialog-title` directive (for the "Create User" case) is applied, it set the `container._ariaLabelledBy` for the first and last time. All future requests to amend the `container._ariaLabelledBy` won't go through, as the value is already present. With current behaviour the only way to provide the accessible description to the dialog is by setting `ariaLabel` within the dialog configuration that is not flexible enough. ### Reproduction I was told that I can skip this step as the developer knows the context. ### Expected Behavior The `aria-labelledby` attributes is updated when a new `mat-dialog-title` is dynamically applied on the dialog. ### Actual Behavior The `aria-labelledby` attributes is not updated, keeping the previous title element id that breaks the accessibility and causes the `aria-dialog-name` violation. ### Environment Angular: 16.2.0-next.2 Globally, the current wrong behaviour does not depend on the environment.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatDialog): mat-dialog-title does not reset the `aria-labelledby" (#27599)

Issues.Title: bug(dialog): document has RTL but dialog rendering LTR
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Angular dialog opened with LTR even thought the document is mentioned as RTL.
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/106318318/c0dc72ac-c63c-4003-ab29-4ab4ebd7fb45)


### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/hg55pw
Steps to reproduce:
1. default app will render with RTL direction
2. click on 'Pick one' button and the popup is render with LTR direction.

Step 1:
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/106318318/4c91dcb7-e04c-4cf1-891a-8e257464285b)

Step 2:
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/106318318/fe09db11-a27a-482c-8cc3-a51a9303513b)


### Expected Behavior

Dialog should render with RTL direction.

### Actual Behavior

Dialog should render with LTR direction.

### Environment

- Angular: 16
- CDK/Material: 16
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(dialog): document has RTL but dialog rendering LTR" (#27592)

Issues.Title: fix(material/snack-bar): Move unthemable tokens to theme mixin
Issues.Body:
Though these tokens are not currently affected by the theme, in the future they will be affected by the design system used for theming (M2 or M3)

BREAKING CHANGE:
There are new styles emitted by `mat.snack-bar-theme` that are not emitted by any of: `mat.snack-bar-color`, `mat.snack-bar-typography`, `mat.snack-bar-density`. If you rely on the partial mixins only and don't call `mat.snack-bar-theme`, you can add `mat.snack-bar-base` to get the missing styles.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/snack-bar): Move unthemable tokens to theme mixin" (#27596)
